00037 #include <stdio.h>
00038 #include <string.h>
00039 #include <stdlib.h>
00040 #include <ctype.h>

00042 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00043 
00044 #define SUCCESS 1
00045 #define TRUE    1
00046 #define FALSE   0
00047 
00048 typedef unsigned int DWORD;
00049 typedef int INT;
00050 typedef int BOOL;
00051 typedef char str[256];
00052 
00053 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00054 
00055 str var_params[100];            /* varables to print 100 each of 256 char lenth */
00056 
00057 DWORD status, start_run, end_run, run;
00058 INT i, quiet, add, j, k, eoln, boln, weight;
00059 char file_name[256], var_name[256];
00060 double total[100], value[100];
00061 str e_var1, e_var2, e_var3;
00062 double var1, var2, var3, sum, sum_var1;

00064 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00065 
00066 BOOL equal_ustring(char *str1, char *str2)
00067 {
00068    if (str1 == NULL && str2 != NULL)
00069       return FALSE;
00070    if (str1 != NULL && str2 == NULL)
00071       return FALSE;
00072    if (str1 == NULL && str2 == NULL)
00073       return TRUE;
00074 
00075    while (*str1)
00076       if (toupper(*str1++) != toupper(*str2++))
00077          return FALSE;
00078 
00079    if (*str2)
00080       return FALSE;
00081 
00082    return TRUE;
00083 }
00084 
00085 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00086 
00087 int odb_hist(char *file_name, int run_number, char *var_name, int quiet,
00088              double *value, int eoln, int boln, int print)
00089 /********************************************************************\
00090 
00091   Routine: odb_hist
00092 
00093   Purpose: Print ODB variable for a single .odb file
00094 
00095   Input:
00096     char *file_name         Name of ODB file
00097     INT  run_number         Run number for ODB file
00098     char *var_name          Name of variable to print
00099     int  quiet              If set, don't print run number
00100     int eoln                end of line used to detemine when to print "\n"
00101     int boln                begin of line used to determin when to print 
00102                             run number if it's needed
00103     int print               used to print or not the value of variable. 
00104                             This it's used for "Emils' function", so it 
00105                             will take and return the value of variable 
00106                             without printing it.
00107     
00108   Note:    
00109     There are two variables eoln and boln because there can be begin 
00110     and end of line together when we have just one variable. 
00111 
00112   Output:
00113     double *value           ODB value in double format
00114 
00115   Function value:
00116     SUCCESS                 Successful completion
00117 
00118 \********************************************************************/
00119 {
00120    FILE *f;
00121    char str[256], path[256], key_name[256], line[256];
00122    int i, index, a, k;
00123 
00124    /* assemble file name */
00125    sprintf(str, file_name, run_number);
00126 
00127    /* split var_name into path and key with index */
00128    strcpy(path, "");
00129    for (i = strlen(var_name) - 1; i >= 0 && var_name[i] != '/'; i--);
00130    if (var_name[i] == '/') {
00131       strcpy(path, "[");
00132       strcat(path, var_name);
00133       path[i + 1] = 0;
00134       strcat(path, "]\n");
00135       strcpy(key_name, var_name + i + 1);
00136    }
00137    if (strchr(key_name, '[')) {
00138       index = atoi(strchr(key_name, '[') + 1);
00139       *strchr(key_name, '[') = 0;
00140    } else
00141       index = -1;
00142 
00143    f = fopen(str, "r");
00144    if (f != NULL) {
00145       if ((!quiet) && boln && print)
00146          printf("%5d: ", run_number);
00147 
00148       /* search path */
00149       do {
00150          fgets(line, sizeof(line), f);
00151          if (line[0] == '[')
00152             if (equal_ustring(line, path)) {
00153                /* look for key */
00154                do {
00155                   fgets(line, sizeof(line), f);
00156                   if (strchr(line, '=') != NULL) {
00157                      strcpy(str, line);
00158                      *(strchr(str, '=') - 1) = 0;
00159 
00160                      /* check if key name matches */
00161                      if (equal_ustring(str, key_name)) {
00162                         if (index == -1) {
00163                            /* non-arrays */
00164                            strcpy(str, strchr(line, '=') + 2);
00165                            if (strchr(str, ':') != NULL) {
00166                               strcpy(str, strchr(str, ':') + 2);
00167                               if (strchr(str, '\n') != NULL)
00168                                  *strchr(str, '\n') = 0;
00169                               if (str[0] == '[' && strchr(str, ']') != NULL)
00170                                  strcpy(str, strchr(str, ']') + 2);
00171                               if (print)
00172                                  printf(str);
00173                               *value = strtod(str, NULL);
00174                               goto finish;
00175                            }
00176                         } else {
00177                            /* arrays */
00178                            for (i = 0; i <= index; i++)
00179                               fgets(line, sizeof(line), f);
00180                            if (line[0] == '[' && atoi(line + 1) == index) {
00181                               strcpy(str, strchr(line, ']') + 2);
00182                               if (strchr(str, '\n') != NULL)
00183                                  *strchr(str, '\n') = 0;
00184                               if (print)
00185                                  printf(str);
00186                               *value = strtod(str, NULL);
00187                            }
00188                            goto finish;
00189                         }
00190 
00191                      }
00192                   }
00193 
00194                } while (line[0] != '[' || line[1] != '/');
00195 
00196             }
00197       } while (!feof(f));
00198 
00199     finish:
00200       if (print) {
00201          if (eoln)
00202             printf("\n");
00203          else {
00204             a = 0;
00205             while (str[a] != '\0')
00206                a++;
00207             k = a;
00208             while ((str[k] != '.') && (k >= 0))
00209                k--;
00210             for (i = 0; i < (10 - (a - k)); i++)
00211                printf(" ");
00212             printf("\t");
00213          }
00214          fclose(f);
00215       }
00216    }
00217    /* f != NULL */
00218    return SUCCESS;
00219 }

00221 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00222 
00223 int load_pars_from_file(char filename[256])
00224 /********************************************************************\
00225 
00226   Routine: load_pars_from_file
00227 
00228   Purpose: Load parameters for odbhist from file
00229 
00230   Input:
00231     char *filename          Name of configuration file
00232 
00233   Output:
00234     <implicit through global variables>
00235 
00236   Function value:
00237     1                       Successful completion
00238     0                       Error
00239 
00240 \********************************************************************/
00241 {
00242    FILE *f1;
00243    char line[256];
00244    int result;
00245    int getstr;
00246 
00247    getstr = 1;
00248 
00249    f1 = fopen(filename, "r");
00250    if (f1 != NULL) {
00251       result = 1;
00252       while (result != 0) {
00253          if (getstr) {
00254             if (fgets(line, sizeof(line), f1) == NULL)
00255                break;
00256          } else
00257             getstr = 1;
00258 
00259          if (line[0] == '[') {
00260             switch (line[1]) {
00261             case 'a':
00262                if (fgets(line, sizeof(line), f1) != NULL) {
00263                   switch (line[0]) {
00264                   case '1':
00265                      add = TRUE;
00266                      break;
00267                   case '0':
00268                      add = FALSE;
00269                      break;
00270                   default:
00271                      result = 0;
00272                   }
00273                } else
00274                   result = 0;
00275                break;
00276 
00277             case 'q':
00278                if (fgets(line, sizeof(line), f1) != NULL) {
00279                   switch (line[0]) {
00280                   case '1':
00281                      quiet = TRUE;
00282                      break;
00283                   case '0':
00284                      quiet = FALSE;
00285                      break;
00286                   default:
00287                      result = 0;
00288                   }
00289                } else
00290                   result = 0;
00291                break;
00292 
00293             case 'f':
00294                if ((fgets(line, sizeof(line), f1) != NULL) && (line[0] != '['))
00295                   strcpy(file_name, line);
00296                else
00297                   result = 0;
00298                break;
00299 
00300             case 'v':
00301                j = -1;
00302                while (fgets(line, sizeof(line), f1) != NULL && line[0] != '[') {
00303                   if (line[0] != '\n')
00304                      strcpy(var_params[++j], line);
00305                }
00306                if (j == -1)
00307                   result = 0;
00308                else
00309                   getstr = 0;
00310 
00311                /* to get correct number of variables in "j" global variable */
00312                if (line[0] != '[')
00313                   j--;
00314                break;
00315 
00316             case 'e':
00317                weight = 1;
00318 
00319                if ((fgets(line, sizeof(line), f1) != NULL) && (line[0] != '['))
00320                   strcpy(e_var1, line);
00321                else {
00322                   result = 0;
00323                   break;
00324                }
00325 
00326                if ((fgets(line, sizeof(line), f1) != NULL) && (line[0] != '['))
00327                   strcpy(e_var2, line);
00328                else {
00329                   result = 0;
00330                   break;
00331                }
00332 
00333                if ((fgets(line, sizeof(line), f1) != NULL) && (line[0] != '['))
00334                   strcpy(e_var3, line);
00335                else {
00336                   result = 0;
00337                   break;
00338                }
00339                break;
00340 
00341             case 'r':
00342                if ((fgets(line, sizeof(line), f1) != NULL) && (line[0] != '['))
00343                   start_run = atoi(line);
00344                else {
00345                   result = 0;
00346                   break;
00347                }
00348                if ((fgets(line, sizeof(line), f1) != NULL) && (line[0] != '['))
00349                   end_run = atoi(line);
00350                else {
00351                   result = 0;
00352                   break;
00353                }
00354 
00355                break;
00356 
00357             default:
00358                result = 0;
00359             }
00360          }
00361       }                         /* while */
00362    } /* if */
00363    else {
00364       result = 0;
00365       printf("\n ERROR:\nCan't open file %s\n", filename);
00366    }
00367    if (result != 0)
00368       if (fclose(f1))
00369          result = 0;
00370 
00371    return result;
00372 }
00373 
00374 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00375 
00376 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00377 {
00378    int cfg, print;
00379 
00380    strcpy(var_name, "/Runinfo/Run number");
00381    strcpy(file_name, "run%05d.odb");
00382    start_run = end_run = 0;
00383    quiet = FALSE;
00384    add = FALSE;
00385    print = 1;                   /* print = 1 means that variable will be printed */
00386 
00387    k = 0;
00388    cfg = 0;
00389    j = -1;
00390 
00391    /* parse command line parameters */
00392 
00393    for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
00394       if (argv[i][0] == '-')
00395          if (argv[i][1] == 'c') {
00396             printf(argv[i + 1]);
00397             printf("\n");
00398             if (!(load_pars_from_file(argv[i + 1])))
00399                goto usage;
00400             else
00401                cfg = 1;
00402          }
00403    }
00404 
00405    for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
00406       if (argv[i][0] == '-') {
00407          if (argv[i][1] == 'q')
00408             quiet = TRUE;
00409          else if (argv[i][1] == 'a')
00410             add = TRUE;
00411          else {
00412             if (i + 1 >= argc || argv[i + 1][0] == '-')
00413                goto usage;
00414             if (argv[i][1] == 'r') {
00415                start_run = atoi(argv[++i]);
00416                end_run = atoi(argv[++i]);
00417             } else if (argv[i][1] == 'v') {
00418                j = -1;          /*if this not used the parameters from here will be add to "v" parameters from cfg file */
00419                while (i + 1 < argc && argv[i + 1][0] != '-')
00420                   if (argv[i + 1][0] != '-') {
00421                      i++;
00422                      j++;
00423                      if (argv[i][0] != '-')
00424                         strcpy(var_params[j], argv[i]);
00425                   }
00426             } else if (argv[i][1] == 'f')
00427                strcpy(file_name, argv[++i]);
00428             else if (argv[i][1] == 'e') {
00429                /* user must be carefull here, he must enter all 3 params */
00430                strcpy(e_var1, argv[++i]);
00431                strcpy(e_var2, argv[++i]);
00432                strcpy(e_var3, argv[++i]);
00433                weight = 1;
00434             } else if (cfg);
00435             else
00436                goto usage;
00437          }
00438       } else if (!cfg) {
00439 
00440        usage:
00441          printf("\nusage: odbhist -r <run1> <run2> -v <varname>[index]\n");
00442          printf("       [-f <filename>] [-q] [-a] [-c <file>]\n");
00443          printf("       [-e <var1> <var2> <var3>]\n\n");
00444          printf("       <run1> <run2>    Range of run numbers (inclusive)\n");
00445          printf
00446              ("       <varname>        ODB variable name like \"/Runinfo/Run number\"\n");
00447          printf("       [index]          Index if <varname> is an array\n");
00448          printf("       -q               Don't display run number\n");
00449          printf("       -a               Add numbers for all runs\n");
00450          printf("       -c               load configuration from file\n");
00451          printf("                        (parameters loaded from cfg file will be\n");
00452          printf("                        overwriten by parameters from command line)\n");
00453          printf("       -e  <var1> <var2> <var3>\n");
00454          printf("                        this parameter will return\n");
00455          printf("                        sum(var1*var2/var3)/sum(var1)\n");
00456          printf("                        summing will be done over all runs\n");
00457          return 0;
00458 
00459       }
00460    }
00461 
00462    if (end_run < start_run) {
00463       printf("Second run is %d and must be larger or equal than first run %d\n",
00464              end_run, start_run);
00465       return 0;
00466    }
00467 
00468    /* printing of header is needed here */
00469    for (run = start_run; run <= end_run; run++) {
00470       for (k = 0; k <= j; k++) {
00471          if (k == j)
00472             eoln = 1;
00473          else
00474             eoln = 0;
00475 
00476          if (k == 0)
00477             boln = 1;
00478          else
00479             boln = 0;
00480 
00481          strcpy(var_name, var_params[k]);
00482          value[k] = 0;
00483 
00484          status = odb_hist(file_name, run, var_name, quiet, &value[k], eoln, boln, print);
00485          if (status != SUCCESS)
00486             break;
00487 
00488          total[k] += value[k];
00489       }                         /*for k */
00490 
00491       if (weight) {
00492          strcpy(var_name, e_var1);
00493          var1 = 0;
00494          status = odb_hist(file_name, run, var_name, quiet, &var1, 0, 0, 0);
00495          if (status != SUCCESS) {
00496             printf("error in -e parameter var1 \n");
00497             goto usage;
00498          }
00499 
00500          strcpy(var_name, e_var2);
00501          var2 = 0;
00502          status = odb_hist(file_name, run, var_name, quiet, &var2, 0, 0, 0);
00503          if (status != SUCCESS) {
00504             printf("error in -e parameter var2\n");
00505             goto usage;
00506          }
00507 
00508          strcpy(var_name, e_var3);
00509          var3 = 0;
00510          status = odb_hist(file_name, run, var_name, quiet, &var3, 0, 0, 0);
00511          if (status != SUCCESS) {
00512             printf("error in -e parameter var3\n");
00513             goto usage;
00514          }
00515 
00516          sum += var1 * var2 / var3;
00517          sum_var1 += var1;
00518       }                         /* if weight */
00519    }                            /* for run */
00520 
00521    if (add) {
00522       printf("\nTotal: ");
00523       if (quiet)
00524          printf("\n");
00525       for (k = 0; k <= j; k++)
00526          printf("%lf\t", total[k]);
00527       printf("\n");
00528    }
00529 
00530    if (weight) {
00531       printf("weighted sum is %lf\n", sum / sum_var1);
00532       printf("sum of var1 is %lf\n", sum_var1);
00533    }
00534 
00535    return 1;
00536 }
